intro: Cnidium silaus var. latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf cnidium, is a variant of the cnidium plant native to certain regions of Asia. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, a feature common in the Apiaceae family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported therapeutic properties. The botanical description highlights its morphological distinctiveness within the species.
